name: Cypress Support Pro
description:
Integrates Cypress under the common Intellij test framework.

Features

  • Introduce Cypress run configuration type
  • Create a test run from directory, spec file, suite or a single test from the editor
  • Report tests live inside IDE using common test view
  • Navigate from test report entries to the code by click
  • Debug support
  • Cypress custom commands as first class citizens
  • Selector language validation and syntax highlighting inside cy.get, cy.find etc. commands
  • Auto completion and navigation for aliases references, fixtures and custom commands
  • Built-In pluggable action recorder
  • Using existing Chrome instance for fast test rerun
  • Run Cucumber tests from IDE

Please report any issues or feature requests on the tracker
notes:
2.0

  • Cypress custom commands as first class citizens:
    • Extract a custom command
    • Generate type definition/implementation stub
    • Navigation to implementation/definition
  • Selector language validation and syntax highlighting inside cy.get, cy.find etc. commands

1.9

  • Auto completion for special character sequences within the type command (like '{backspace}')
  • Auto completion and navigation for a file path within readFile, writeFile and screenshot commands

1.8

  • Auto completion and navigation for fixture in a StaticResponse object (within intercept, send and reply commands)

1.7

  • Support Edge run option
  • Support debug and record for Chromium based browsers (Electron & Edge)

1.6.3

  • Fix the Config cache problem (issues #30 and #31)
  • Other small fixes

1.6.2
  • 'intellij-cypress-reporter' dependency is optional now. The plugin will use a built-in one if none found in the project
  • Support for specs placed outside of Cypress project directory (fix issue #25)
  • Do not hide other test runners for non-Cypress tests (fix issue #28)
  • Test report to code navigation fixed for Cucumber runs
  • Other small fixes

1.6.1

  • Debugger connection stabilized
  • Ability to disable aliases, custom commands and fixtures navigation and autocomplete via Platform registry keys

1.6

  • Cucumber execution support

1.5

  • Built-In pluggable action recorder

1.4

  • Open Cypress screenshots for a test in the tree view by action
  • Run configuration UI improvements (browser selection and others)

1.3

  • Auto completion and navigation to the definition for:
    • Alias references
    • Fixtures
    • Custom commands (available for javascript files only as typescript has ability to define the types explicitly)
  • Several small fixes
1.2
  • Debug support
  • 'Allow parallel run' config option support: now subsequent test runs try to use existing Cypress/Chrome instance (that was started by the first run) if possible. Please note that Cypress does not reflect code changes when run in non interactive mode so this feature is mostly suitable for the interactive mode
  • Now support running single suites (in addition to single cases)
  • Refactor single case execution to modify direct source and do not generate additional __only file
  • Reference a case by name instead of range index so it now stay stable over source modifications
